intro: Hedyosmum colombianum, commonly known as the Colombian hedyosmum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
